document.heading: Roadway, Alley and Sidewalk Improvement Act of 1994

history.narrative: Law 10-186, the “Roadway, Alley and Sidewalk Improvement Act of 1994,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 10-295, which was referred to the Committee on Public Works and the Environment. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 21, 1994, and July 5, 1994, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on July 26, 1994, it was assigned Act No. 10-312 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 10-186 became effective on September 24, 1994.
